meanings.definition: To strike or tap with a gavel.
meanings.sent1: The judge gavelled the desk to silence the courtroom.
meanings.sent2: She gavelled the table to start the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The teacher gavelled the book to get the students' attention.
meanings.sent4: The conductor gavelled the music stand to begin the performance.
meanings.sent5: The coach gavelled the whiteboard to begin the game strategy discussion.

meanings.definition: To bring a meeting or session to order by using a gavel.
meanings.sent1: The mayor gavelled the council meeting to begin the discussion.
meanings.sent2: He gavelled the conference to start the presentation.
meanings.sent3: The captain gavelled the team huddle to focus the players.
meanings.sent4: The principal gavelled the assembly to start the school announcements.
meanings.sent5: The chairperson gavelled the seminar to introduce the guest speaker.
